data.title: Daniel Fox, J.D.
data.meta_description: Joined the Ashland University faculty in 2004Â  Served as associate dean and director of entrepreneurship for the College of Business and Economics Licensed Ohio attorney Certified Public Accountant Consulted for the world's largest oil company, Saudi Aramco, in Saudi Arabia Worked for the "Big Eight" accounting firm of Coopers & Lybrand and the law firm of Emens, Hurd, Kegler & Ritter, practicing business and tax law Consults with startup and entrepreneurial companies, providing legal, accounting and operational
data.text:
Dean, College of Business & Economics

Associate Professor of Law

248 Dauch College of Business and Economics

Biography

Joined the Ashland University faculty in 2004

Served as associate dean and director of entrepreneurship for the College of Business and Economics

Licensed Ohio attorney

Certified Public Accountant

Consulted for the world's largest oil company, Saudi Aramco, in Saudi Arabia

Worked for the "Big Eight" accounting firm of Coopers & Lybrand and the law firm of Emens, Hurd, Kegler & Ritter, practicing business and tax law

Consults with startup and entrepreneurial companies, providing legal, accounting and operational advice

Education

Ohio Northern School of Law, Juris Doctor

Ohio Northern University, B.A. in Accounting and Political Science
